result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea L Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Andrea L Phillips was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrea L Phillips is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Andrea L Phillips was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Andrea L Phillips was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Jefferson County with no release for conditional time.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Defendant ordered not to possess or control any firearms.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for employment and counseling. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Defendant Andrea L Phillips in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State rec:  Ct 2 Obstr. & Ct 3 D.C.:  20 days jail on each Ct/cons. to each other.

Statement by Attorney Lang.  Statement by Defendant.  Statement by Defendant's boyfriend, R.C.  

BTC:  Ct 2 Obstr.:  6 months jail, I&S, 1 yr. prob.  conditions:  90 days jail/CFTS, Huber Law for employment & counseling, maintain sobriety, no alc in residence, N/C with any bars, no C/S, attend counseling, F.T. employment or F.T. school.  no F/A.  $150 + CC, apply bond.
Ct 3 D.C.:  30 days jail, 1 yr prob/conc to Ct 2.  Same conditions except for jail time.  $150.00 + CC, apply bond.
Def may transfer probation to Jefferson County, when serving jail sentence, no release for conditional time.  Report in Date:  12-03-16.
Sentencing hearing on October 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.  Defendant Andrea L Phillips in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang-Muffitt.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AMENDED Information filed.  P-NG.  Stipulation filed.  States Motions in Limine were approved at prior hearing.  

Jury Panel into Courtroom.  Oath #1.  Voir Dire.  Juror #8 struck for cause.  Juror #12 struck for cause.  Jury panel selected.  Oath #2.  Preliminary Instruction by the Court.  

Opening Statement - ADA Schwab.  Opening Statement - Attorney Lang -Muffitt.  

Testimony by witness H.W. - DSAT
Cross exam.  Redirect.  Recross.  Redirect.
Witness excused.

Cross exam.  
Witness excused.  

Plf rests.  Stipulation read by the Court into the record.  

Defenses moves to dismiss.  

BTC:  Motion to dismiss - Denied.  

Testimony by witness/defendant A.P. - DSAT
Cross exam.  Redirect.
Witness excused.  

Defense rests.

Verdict forms discussed.  Jury instructions discussed.  

Jury instructions by the Court.  

Closing Arguements - DAD Schwab.  Closing Arguements - Attorney Lang-Muffitt.  Rebuttal Arguement - ADA Schwab.  

Final Instruction by the Court.  Oath to Bailiffs.

Ct 1:  OWI -    Not Guilty
Ct 2:  Obstr. - Guilty
Ct 3:  D.C. -   Guilty
Ct 4:  PAC -   Not Guilty

Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***2-2-16 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO REMOVE THE SCRAM UNIT. DEFT MUST BE TESTED AT LEAST 3 TIMES PER WEEK AND AFTER EVERY COURT APPEARANCE***  ***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.   Do not drive at all.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

State requests that the SCRAM unit remain in place.
BTC: Motion to modify bond is granted, modify bond to remove the SCRAM unit, deft must be tested at least 3 times per week and after every court appearance.
